info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 26 at 6:19PM CDT until May 26 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS San Angelo TX
info.description:
At 613 PM CDT, The public reported street flooding in Menard at 516 PM. 2.3 inches of rain were reported by the West Texas Mesonet 2 miles northeast of Menard at 617. 2.26 inches were reported at LCRA gages 12 miles southeast of Menard and 2.63 inches 15 miles west of Mason. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area scattered showers and thunderstorms continued. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly.
HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding.
SOURCE...Public reported.
IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses.
Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Menard, Hext, Saline, Long Mountain, Streeter, Grit, Camp Air, Live Oak, The Intersection Of Us-83 And Highway 29, Us-190 Near The Menard-Mcculloch County Line, The Intersection Of Us-83 And Ranch Road 1773, Us-83 Near The Menard-Concho County Line, Us-83 Near The Kimble-Menard County Line, Us-377 Near The Kimble-Menard County Line, Erna and The Intersection Of Highway 29 And Ranch Road 1222.
This includes the following Low Water Crossings... crossings along FM 1221, Decker St. crossing San Saba River, Old Junction crossing Honey Creek, Turkey SpringS crossing, Red crossing Little Bluff Creek, Hungry Hollow crossing, Long Mountain crossing, Chimney Hollow crossing Big Bluff Creek, Sandy crossing and Ranch Road 2291 crossing Las Moras Creek.
info.instruction: Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

parameter.value: FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR SOUTHERN CONCHO, NORTHWESTERN MASON AND MENARD COUNTIES

area.areaDesc: Concho, TX; Mason, TX; Menard, TX
